To simplify the radical expression $$\sqrt{72}$$, we need to find the prime factors of 72 and then pair them up.

First, find the prime factors of 72:
$$72 = 2 × 36$$
$$36 = 2 × 18$$
$$18 = 2 × 9$$
$$9 = 3 × 3$$

So, the prime factors of 72 are: $$2 × 2 × 2 × 3 × 3$$

Now, pair up the prime factors:
$$\sqrt{72} = \sqrt{2 × 2 × 2 × 3 × 3}$$

For each pair of the same number, we can take one number out of the square root:
$$\sqrt{2 × 2 × 2 × 3 × 3} = 2\sqrt{2 × 3 × 3} = 2\sqrt{18}$$

Thus, the simplified radical expression is: $$2\sqrt{18}$$.
